meanings.definition: A device used to measure the electrical responses of the retina.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used an electroretinograph to check the health of my eye.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying how to improve the accuracy of electroretinographs.
meanings.sent3: The electroretinograph beeped happily when it detected a strong signal.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like an electroretinograph, revealing her excitement.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the gentle hum of the electroretinograph as it worked.

meanings.definition: The process of using electroretinographs to diagnose eye conditions.
meanings.sent1: The hospital has a specialized department dedicated to electroretinography.
meanings.sent2: Doctors rely on electroretinography to identify retinal disorders early.
meanings.sent3: During the eye exam, the patient joked that the electroretinography machine was a mind reader.
meanings.sent4: The precision of electroretinography is like having a superpower to see inside the eye.
meanings.sent5: The clarity of the results from electroretinography amazed the medical team.
